intro: Guatteria clavigera, commonly known as the Mexican wax tree, is a species of flowering plant in the family Lauraceae. It is native to tropical regions of Central America and northern South America. The plant is characterized by its evergreen leaves and showy, fragrant flowers that bloom in clusters. It produces small, round fruits that are typically green when mature. Guatteria clavigera is often cultivated for its ornamental value and is also used in traditional medicine in some regions.
